oai_dc:dc.dc:title: New records of exotic crickets in Europe: Homoeogryllus species (Orthoptera: Gryllidea: Phalangopsidae)
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Żurawlew, Przemysław
Desutter-Grandcolas, Laure
Szymański, Paweł
Herman, David Billy
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: invasion biology
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: <jats:p>This short note lists new records of exotic crickets belonging to the genus <jats:italic>Homoeogryllus</jats:italic> (Orthoptera: Gryllidea: Phalangopsidae) in Europe (Poland and Belgium) and discusses the most probable scenarios of their arrival from tropical regions. Photographs and stridulation spectrograms of these crickets are provided. The report concludes that handling terminals and warehouses with tropical plants are the most common sites in Europe where exotic species of different taxa are recorded. The species <jats:italic>Homoeogryllus longicornis</jats:italic> (Walker, 1869) is also reclassified to the genus <jats:italic>Meloimorpha</jats:italic> Walker, 1870.</jats:p>
